text: @boyblob This is one reason why I'm glad that thumbs-downs on comments are no longer visible by default. At first, I was a bit annoyed, but now I see the wisdom behind it: it encourages people to state why they dislike a comment, not just click a button and forget about it.

author: Arcanium Maximus

text: I don't find their responses very insulting at all.  So they think it sucks. So what maybe we could have a discussion about it. Marking them down comes off as people getting pissed off that they ripped apart their childhood memories. What's the difference between a comment stating "this sucks tbh" and "kickass song"  Not much thought thrown into the comment but just because one is negative people mark it down. I just figure that we are above this.
